function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased humidity can decrease the inactivation of bacterial and viral aerosols, potentially leading to higher transmission of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Higher risk of transmission of contagious diseases in environments with increased humidity.","Mitigation":"Ensure adequate ventilation and air circulation in high-humidity environments to minimize the risk of aerosol transmission.","Technologies":"Use upper-room germicidal UV (GUV) systems and ceiling fans to enhance effectiveness in high-humidity environments.","People":"Occupants of built environments with high humidity, especially in crowded and poorly ventilated spaces.","Owner":"Building managers, ventilation engineers, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Lack of data on the effectiveness of UV-C inactivating SARS-CoV-2, which may lead to uncertainty in the selection of appropriate control measures for the virus.","Impact":"Uncertainty in the effectiveness of UV-C for inactivating SARS-CoV-2, potentially leading to inadequate control measures.","Mitigation":"Conduct specific studies to evaluate the effectiveness of UV-C inactivating SARS-CoV-2 and implement alternative control measures where effectiveness is uncertain.","Technologies":"Research on the specific effectiveness of UV-C inactivating SARS-CoV-2 and development of alternative technologies for virus inactivation.","People":"Public health researchers, infectious disease experts, and policymakers responsible for implementing control measures.","Owner":"Public health organizations, governmental health agencies, and research institutions."},{"Description":"Potential reliance on upper-room germicidal UV (GUV) systems as the primary control measure, leading to neglect of other essential infection control strategies.","Impact":"Neglect of other essential infection control strategies due to overreliance on GUV systems, potentially leading to incomplete protection against contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Implement a comprehensive infection control strategy that includes a combination of ventilation optimization, air filtration, and other proven infection control measures in addition to GUV systems.","Technologies":"Integration of GUV systems with HVAC (heating, ventilation, and air conditioning) systems, air purification technologies, and environmental monitoring systems.","People":"Building managers, public health officials, and infection control specialists responsible for designing and implementing infection control measures.","Owner":"Building management, public health agencies, and infection control committees."}]}
